messages.body:
Daniel Egodima 

FROM: DANIEL EGODIMA  
ATT:Lewis D. Noogie  
Dear Sir,  

I am DANIEL EGODIMA a solicitor at law. I am the Personal Attorney to
Mr. Mark . Noogie, a National of your Country,who has lived in Nigeria
for the past fifty years, and whom here in after shall be referred to as
my client.In April 1999, my client, was involved in a fatal car accident
. All occupants of the vehicle unfortunately lost there lives, my client
was one of them. 
 
I have contacted you to assist in repatriating most especially,the money
left behind by my client before they get confiscated or declared
unserviceable by the bank where this huge deposits were lodged.
Particularly, the CHARTARED INVESTMENT TRUST BANK where the deceased had
an account valued at about 8 million dollars has issued me a notice to
provide the Next of kin, or have the account confiscated. 
 
I seek your consent to present you as the Next of kin of the deceased
since you have the same last name so that the proceeds of this account
valued at 8 million dollars can be paid to you, as my clients Next of
Kin, and then we can share the amount on a mutual agreed percentage.All
legal documents to back up your claim as the deceased Next of Kin, will
be provided. All I require is your honest cooperation to enable us see
this deal through.  

I guarantee that this will be executed under a legitimate arrangement
that will protect you from anybreach of the law. Please get in touch
with me, to enable us discuss further about this transaction. 
 
Best regards,  

DANIEL EGODIMA (ESQ)

messages.body:
Mr. Egodima, 

This is about the 15th letter I've received about one of my relatives
dying in a car crash in Africa. I am beginning to suspect that most auto
accidents in Africa are caused by drivers swerving to avoid all the
Noogie family corpses that litter the highways. 

I never recognized any of the names from the previous letters. I do,
however, have an uncle named Marcus (Mark for short), and my brother
told me he thinks that uncle Marcus did live in Africa, at least for
awhile. Can you provide me with some additional details about your Mark
Noogie? It would be amazing if I was his only surviving relative.
 
I anxiously await your response. 

Lewis D. Noogie

messages.body:
Daniel,

Oh, THAT Elijah. My mistake.

Having thought it over, I am prepared to assist you in this, with
certain constraints, at least until I come to know you better.

With the high risk of identity theft so prevalent these days, I am not
at this time prepared to send you a copy of my drivers license or
passport. I'm sure you understand. Once I have seen some evidence that
this transaction is real I would at that time be prepared to provide
such documents. The same goes for my bank account information. I have no
objection, however, to providing my full name, mailing address,
birthdate or any other information that you feel would be useful at this
stage of the transaction.

As for a fax or phone number, I need to explain a little bit about
myself first. I am an international hotel consultant, based out of
Tblisi, Georgia, currently consulting to a hotel here in Novosibirsk,
Lithuania. I have a signed agreement with my partners that I will accept
no involvement with any business outside of our company. Both my
partners have access to virtually all of my communications with the
exception of my personal email account. I cannot risk my position with
my company so we will have to restrain our communications to email for
the time being.

I also strongly believe that it's good business practice to get to know
people you work with on a social basis. With this in mind, would you
mind giving me a bit of information about yourself, e.g., age, marital
status, children (if any), hobbies, that sort of thing.

I look forward to working with you, Dan. By the way, my friends call me
Lewd (short for Lewis D.)

Lewd

messages.body:
Dan, 

Thanks for getting back so quickly. You might want to think about
getting the old keyboard looked at. My caps lock gets dicked up once in
awhile, too. 

Danny, my man, I have no objection to providing you whatever information
you need for this but I'm not going to send scanned copies of my
passport or drivers license until I have some proof that this
transaction is on the up-and-up. Tell me what information you need from
my passport or drivers license and I'll send it. 

As far as a new account for this, it's going to take me a day or two to
set it up.
 
As far as a fax and phone number, please see my last email to you. I
think I adequately explained THAT situation. 

I understand that I will be required to spend money and I'm prepared to
do so. As long as you or the bank provides proper documentation for any
expenditure, I have no problem with shelling out a few kopeks for this
project. 

As far as getting the approved documents to me, just send them as email
attachments. 

So you have four kids, eh? How did your wife hold up after four kids?
Mine, when I was married, got big as a house after just one! But I'll
tell you more about that later. 

Ok, Dan, let me know what you need. 

Your friend, 

Lewd 

PS - By the way, did it ever occur to you that maybe I AM Mark Noogie's
closest surviving relative?

Tell me what information you need from my passport or drivers license and I'll send it.

As far as a new account for this, it's going to take me a day or two to set it up.

messages.body:
Dan, 

Suicide mission? Aha ha ha! Good one! You are one zany fella!
 
No, dear boy, I communicate with my brother by email or instant
messaging. Works great. 
 
I'll try and address your items in the order you wrote them:
 
1. As far as the internet not being a safe place to send money documents
- if you're concerned about sending the pin code with the documents, the
obvious soution is to send the pin code separately.
 
2. My Name - Lewis D. Noogie
 
3. Bank Name - Don't know yet. Like I told you before, I have to open
the account in the next day or two.
 
4. Bank Address, Telex, Fax, Phone - See item 3 above.
 
5. Account Number - See items 3 and 4 above.
 
6. My Personal Address - % Hotel Bolshoi Shutka, 19 Huisos Ulitsa,
Tblisi, Georgia
 
7. Passport copy - Danny, you gotta start reading my emails a little
closer. In the future I'll try to keep them shorter so your lips don't
get tired. I told you as soon as I've seen something that convinces me
that this is the real deal, THEN I'll send my passport copy.
 
One other item - in your first letter to me you stated that the
percentage split would be mutually agree to, and I never agreed to you
getting 60%. Remember, the dead guy is a Noogie and I'm a Noogie, which
makes me the key to this transaction. I think a 50-50 split would be
much more appropriate, don't you?
 
Lewd

messages.body:
Daniel,
 
We need to work out a minor detail before we go any further.
 
If you go back to your first email to me and read it closely, you will
find that it states in the third paragraph, "...and then we can share
the amount on a mutual agreed percentage.". Now if you go back through
all of MY previous email, nowhere will you find that I agreed to a
30-10-60 split. As far as I'm concerned, there is no mutually agreed-to
percentage spit on this deal and your offer of 30% is bogus, considering
that I am the KEY here. I'm the Noogie, not you! 

I suggest at this point we first iron out the percentage split. Having
considered the now-obvious risks in this venture, I feel that 70% for me
and 30% for you, after expenses, would be more equitable. There is no
need to map out 10% for expenses; when the deal has been consumated,
whatever is left over after expenses are paid will be split 70-30.
 
Please let me know if this is acceptable.
 
Sincerely,
 
Lewd

messages.body:
Daniel, 

Wife?? Wife?? Daniel, I already HAD one of those! Listen, when we get
you to Georgia, I'm gonna fix you up with one of those Ukrainian village
girls and show you what I'm talking about. I guarantee that if you
survive your first encounter, you'll never go back. Don't worry, Dan,
I'll take care of you. 

Listen, you gotta understand that this is kind of a backward country.
They still use horses to pull wagons here. It's hard enough just getting
access to the internet over the phone lines, let alone trying to find
something like a Western Union. And as far as safe, I don't know
anything safer than transfering money through banks. We have to drag you
into the 21st century, my friend. 

Let's do this - there are going to be expenses at both ends of this
transfer. Why don't you handle the ones at that end and I'll take care
of the ones here. We're both going to get reimbursed for expenses anyhow
and it would save the hassle of sending money back and forth.
 
I'm still waiting for the documentation.
 
Lewd

messages.body:
Dan,
  
I appreciate your desire to want this transaction to move along as
quickly as possible. Believe me, no one want as much as I do for this
transaction to go smoothly and quickly. However, I have been involved in
business deals before where I lost money for not being very concientious
regarding the details and the paperwork. In one instance I lost a lot of
money because paperwork was incorrect.  

If you have had the document corrected, just scan it and send it to me
and we can get this moving.  

Dan, I dont know how it is in your country, but when you ask me a
question I try to be sure that I give you an answer. I like a partner
who's focused on business, but I would like to have the same courtesy,
please. I have asked you a number of times if you would mind
corresponding with Olga's younger sister. I'm not asking you to marry
her, just to write to her once in awhile. They are driving me nuts,
asking me about it every day. What do you think?  

Your pal,
Lewd

messages.body:
Daniel,  

Thanks for getting back to me.  

Tell me something - is this your first time at doing business on an
international scale? It sure sounds like it is. Daniel, let me explain
something - no foreign businessman who has any idea what he is doing is
going to start throwing money around until the required documentation is
in place. If you don't like the way I do business, then you should find
someone else to work with. I think it's extremely unreasonable for you
to think otherwise.  

I have already told you - I expect to have to pay fees and such for this
transaction and I'm more than willing to do so, but I don't think it's
unreasonable to want proper documents in place first. And no, I don't
know how hard it is to get these documents corrected, but I do know that
these errors occurred at YOUR end, not mine. It's you or the people
you're working with who are screwing this deal up. You should be
checking these documents before you accept them.  

As far as letting my worker read the documents, she is my
personal and private secretary; I trust her completely and she keeps all
my information confidential. There has been no breach of security here.
  
Daniel, I know how these things work. You're going to go in there to
make the transfer and somebody is going to notice the discrepancies and
you and I will be over a barrel. Let's do this the proper way so that
there is no chance of anymore screwups, ok?  

Lewd

I sent my personal secretary, on a mission this
morning to look for a Western Union office or some acceptable
alternative. I am saddened to say, however, that I have discovered
another error in the documentation, this time a major one. This one may
be a show-stopper.
  
In the 'Certificate of Deposit' from the Chartered Investment Trust
Bank, the date indicated when Mark Noogie made the deposit is January
9th, 2002. In your first letter to me you stated that he was involved in
a fatal car accident in April, 1999. Something doesn't ring right here.
If I go by the date indicated on the deposit certificate, he made the
deposit all most three years after he died!
  
Daniel, theres just too much sloppy work going on down there at your end
of this transaction. I'm sorry, my friend, but I have made the clear
decision to not invest any more money in this deal until all the
paperwork is corrected. As you said, I don't know how business is done
there in Nigeria, but this sort of thing is unacceptable ANYWHERE.

when all of this is taken care of.   

Your pal,
